[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Job Recruitment & Application Platform (JRAP) defines requirements for job postings, applicant tracking, interview scheduling, and candidate management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: JRAP supports job listing creation, application tracking, interview scheduling, and recruiter collaboration.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: JRAP integrates with applicant tracking systems, email, and authentication services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: JRAP provides a web and mobile UI for job seekers and recruiters.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: JRAP supports desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: JRAP uses REST APIs, OAuth authentication, and cloud storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: JRAP supports messaging, notifications, and video interviews.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: JRAP optimizes storage for job postings and candidate profiles.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: JRAP enables job postings, application tracking, interviews, and collaboration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: JRAP customizes job recommendations based on user activity.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: JRAP connects with job boards, background verification, and payroll systems for seamless hiring.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: JRAP enables recruiters to post jobs, manage applications, schedule interviews, and communicate with candidates. Job seekers can search, apply, and track applications.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: JRAP serves job seekers, recruiters, and HR managers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: JRAP requires internet access for real-time updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: JRAP relies on job board APIs, cloud storage, and secure authentication.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall allow recruiters to create and manage job postings.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall allow job seekers to search and apply for jobs.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall support resume uploads and candidate tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow TO-BE-DEFINED (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow job seekers to search, filter, apply for jobs, track application status, and receive personalized job recommendations (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for job searching and recruiter interactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process job searches and applications within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store job postings, applications, candidate profiles, resumes, recruiter feedback, and interview schedules.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall provide adaptive job recommendations.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with employment data privacy laws.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure encrypted data storage and secure authentication.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests validate job postings, search accuracy, application tracking, and notifications.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Job posting standards, applicant tracking practices, and GDPR compliance.
